column4: Software update won't work. It says there are too many errors. How do I clear out the corrupted updates which downloaded, so that I can download them again?
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade does what
do sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade in the terminal and if you get an error message paste it, if it is very long pastebin it
that tells me I am about to do something potentially harmful.... shall I proceed?
it tells me this http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/10987/ - should I proceed?
I would go for it, so long as you reinstall tar later, all will be fine
there is something wrong with openoffice.org-common
if it was my system I would sudo apt-get remove that
i tried sudo apt-get remove openoffice.org-common ...I still get the error http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/10988/
sudo apt-get remove ubuntu-desktop tar openoffice.org-common

none of this is working.. isn't there some way I can just delete all this crap and re-download it? I am beginning to think it might just be easier to format and re-install from scratch since this is a clean install off a CD, and there is nothing on the hard drive I need to keep :(
